solution.text:
The zero of \(x+_{j}_\,\) is \(-_{j}_\)
Substituting the zero of \(g(x)\,\) in \(p(x)\) should give a remainder \(0\,\) as \(g(x)\,\) is a factor of \(p(x)\)
\(p(-_{j}_)=(_{k}_ \times (-_{j}_)^3)-(_{l}_ \times (-_{j}_)^2) + (_{m}_ \times (-_{j}_)) - a=0\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{-k*j*j*j}}_-_{{l*j*j}}_-_{{m*j}}_-a=0\)
\(\Rightarrow _{{-k*j*j*j - l*j*j -m*j}}_=a\)
Therefore, \(a=_{{-k*j*j*j - l*j*j -m*j}}_\)

content.text: Find the value of \(a\,\) if \(x+_{j}_\,\) is a factor of \(_{k}_x^3-_{l}_x^2+_{m}_x-a\).
